CEO of Shortcut Ventures GmbH in Hamburg, Germany.

Dirk Freise is one of the CEOs of the venture capital firm, Shortcut Ventures, located in Hamburg, Germany. Freise graduated with a degree in Business Administration from the University of Hamburg and completed his MBA at the Haas School of Business (UC Berkeley), majoring in strategy and entrepreneurship.

In 1999, he set up handy.de, which became Europeâ€™s largest provider of mobile entertainment services with business partners Martin Ostermayer and Thorsten Rehling. They also created blau.de, the first independent wireless service discounter in Germany, in 2005. They led the company until 2011.
